sn47.21:4.2: At one time Venerables Ānanda and Bhadda were staying at Pāṭaliputta, in the Chicken Monastery.
sn47.21:4.3: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Bhadda came out of solitude, went to Venerable Ānanda,
sn47.21:4.5: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side,
sn47.21:4.7: “Reverend Ānanda, the Buddha has spoken of skillful ethics. What’s their purpose?”
sn47.21:5.2: Your approach and articulation are excellent, and it’s a good question.
sn47.21:5.4: ‘The Buddha has spoken of skillful ethics. What’s their purpose?’”
sn47.21:5.6: “The Buddha has spoken of skillful ethics to the extent necessary for developing the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
sn47.21:6.2: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.21:6.3: They meditate by observing an aspect of feelings …
sn47.21:6.5: principles, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.21:6.6: The Buddha has spoken of skillful ethics to the extent necessary for developing the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.”
